battleCards.title: The Context Sandwich
battleCards.description: Always wrap your request with context before and constraints after. AI performs best when it knows the full picture.
battleCards.code:
[Context] I'm building a Telegram bot for content approval.
[Request] Add a command that shows pending items.
[Constraints] Use TypeScript. Keep it under 30 lines.

battleCards.title: Model Selection Matrix
battleCards.description: Don't use Opus for everything. Match the model to the task complexity.
battleCards.code:
Simple tasks ‚Üí Haiku ($0.001)
Most coding  ‚Üí Sonnet ($0.01)
Architecture ‚Üí Opus ($0.05)

battleCards.title: The 4-Round Dance
battleCards.description: Build features in exactly 4 iterations. More means you're going in circles.
battleCards.code:
Round 1: Core functionality
Round 2: Edge cases
Round 3: Error handling
Round 4: Polish

battleCards.title: The Fresh Start Signal
battleCards.description: If you've been debugging the same bug for 5+ iterations, the approach is wrong. Reset.
battleCards.code:
"Let's start fresh. Forget the previous
approach. Here's what I actually need:
[clearer description]"

battleCards.title: Show, Don't Tell
battleCards.description: Instead of describing what you want, show an example. AI learns patterns faster than specifications.

battleCards.title: Voice + AI = Speed
battleCards.description: Dictation is 3-4x faster than typing. Use Wispr Flow or similar to speak your prompts.
battleCards.code:
[Speak] "Create a function that
validates email addresses"
[AI generates]
[Speak] "Now add plus addressing"

battleCards.title: The Structure Dump
battleCards.description: AI can't see your project. Always share the file tree at the start of complex tasks.
battleCards.code:
My project:
src/
  bot.ts
  handlers/
  api/
.env
package.json

battleCards.title: API > Browser
battleCards.description: Before automating anything via browser, check if an API exists. API is 10x more reliable.
battleCards.code:
‚ùå Browser automation for X posting
‚úÖ X API for posting

‚ùå Clicking through GitHub UI
‚úÖ gh CLI commands

tips.title: Be specific, get specific
tips.text: "Make a website" ‚Üí 50% accuracy. "Next.js landing with hero, 3 cards, Tailwind" ‚Üí 95%.

tips.title: Always show file structure
tips.text: AI can't see your project. Paste the tree or describe the layout.

tips.title: Iterate in small steps
tips.text: Don't ask for everything at once. Build features one layer at a time.

tips.title: Test after each change
tips.text: Run the code after every iteration. Catch errors early, fix fast.

tips.title: Ship the MVP
tips.text: First version doesn't need persistence. It just needs to work.

tips.title: API costs add up
tips.text: Heavy dev day: $5-15. Use Haiku for simple tasks. Be concise.

tips.title: Git is non-negotiable
tips.text: Every AI tool assumes version control. Learn add, commit, push.

tips.title: Grok for images
tips.text: Included with X Premium. Fast iterations, no extra credits.

tips.title: Read error messages
tips.text: Copy the full error to AI. Half of debugging is just asking the right question.

tips.title: Know when to stop
tips.text: Diminishing returns are real. If it works 90%, ship and iterate.

tips.title: Speak complete thoughts
tips.text: When dictating, finish the sentence. Fragments confuse both you and the AI.

tips.title: Ride the wave
tips.text: Tools change monthly. Learn patterns, not specific UIs.

tools.name: Claude Code
tools.bestFor: Complex reasoning, file editing, long context

communityPosts.author: Andrej Karpathy
communityPosts.content: The hottest new programming language is English. The skill isn't writing code anymore‚Äîit's describing what you want clearly enough that AI gets it right.

communityPosts.author: swyx
communityPosts.content: Vibe coding tip: if you've been going back and forth with the AI for 5+ iterations on the same bug, your original approach is wrong. Start fresh with a clearer description.

communityPosts.author: Free River House
communityPosts.content: Built a complete approval bot in 30 minutes with Claude Code. The prompt was 6 lines. The bot is 150 lines. The ratio is everything.

communityPosts.author: Pieter Levels
communityPosts.content: Stop learning frameworks. Learn prompting. I've shipped more in the last 6 months using AI than in the previous 5 years writing code by hand.

starter.name: Starter
starter.description: Claude Pro + Copilot. Enough to learn and build real things.

professional.name: Professional
professional.description: Full stack for serious building. API usage, deployment, everything.

enterprise.name: Enterprise
enterprise.description: Production-ready. Monitoring, error tracking, CI/CD, the works.

postIdeas.content: Unexpectedly back on Safari after years of Chrome. The reason? I gave Chrome to my AI agent. Claude in Chrome runs my browser automation. I browse on Safari now. The future is weird.
